result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacey J Raasch

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Defendant Lacey J Raasch in court.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Last hearing was held on August 24, 2022 and she appears today without counsel.
Defendant is informed of her right to having counsel represent her.
Defendant has not received a copy of the complaint.
ADA Dodge does not have a copy of the complaint for Lacey but does provide the complaint from Laurie Raasch as the charges are nearly identical.
Court questions the defendant as to why she does not wish to have counsel.  She responds.
Court recommends that the defendant obtain counsel.
Court questions the defendant as to how she wishes to proceed.
Defendant will see if she is eligible for state public defender representation.
If she is not eligible for public defender representation then she can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
Address clarified.

BY THE COURT: 
Defendant to go to the public defender's office today.
Bond is continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lacey J Raasch
Current: 325 Michigan Ave., #2, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 09-08-2022)
Prior: 325 Michigan Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Initial Appearance set for 10/10/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 3
No contact with the Walmart in Portage County

11:06 AM Defendant Lacey Joleen Raasch appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Retail Theft - Intentionally Take $500-$5,000.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
